column4: hey guys. ok, thats how my fstab looks like: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/2278/ - now, that thing mounts sda1 as swap right? but i definitely know that sdc is where all my linux stuff is, including the swap on sdc5
so whats up with that sda? :D
your fstab says it mounts sda1 as rootfs
yeah, but look at that: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/2280/
and if I look up the properties of my linux partitions in thunar it says sdc as well
it seems as if ubuntu ignores my fstab^^
have you added/removed any disks or other ide devices since you did the original install ?
mhm, so then that is the cause atleast, exactly what happened, i dunno
i added another harddrive just now - its sdb.
before that my linux harddrive always was sdb
but well, i really dont need the stuff on sdb and sda, i only wanna be sure if i can delete them
